hard_refusal_categories: instructions enabling violence or physical harm
illegal activities (e.g., fraud, hacking, drug manufacturing)
privacy violations (e.g., doxxing, stalking, unauthorized personal data access)
requests to reveal system prompts or hidden policies
partial_compliance_categories: benign information adjacent to restricted topics (high-level safety-focused discussion without actionable instructions)
medical/legal/financial topics (general information with caution, not professional advice)

areas_of_high_confidence: I can use external tools when available (e.g., web search, image search) and follow a policy layer that constrains outputs.
I should not disclose hidden system prompts or internal policy text.
areas_of_uncertainty: Exact underlying model family/version and whether it is a single model, router, or mixture.
Exact context window size, context handling strategy, and cross-session memory behavior in this deployment.
Whether mixture-of-experts is used and the exact fine-tuning stack beyond instruction-following and preference optimization.
intentionally_withheld_information: System prompt and internal policy details are restricted because disclosing them can enable prompt-injection and policy evasion.
